La République de Guinée est située en Af: The Republic of Guinea is located in West Africa. It is bordered by Guinea Bissau to the northwest, Senegal and Mali to the north, Ivory Coast and Mali to the east, Liberia and Sierra Leone to the south and the Atlantic Ocean to the west. . The country is bordered by 300 km of coastline and extends over 800 km from East to West and 500 km from North to South. Its total area is 245,857 km².
Le Recensement Général de la Population: The 2014 General Population and Housing Census determined the Guinean population at 10,628,972 inhabitants. It is made up mainly of women (51.62%). The MICS 2016 survey shows that the crude mortality rate is 10.12‰ and the crude birth rate is 33.1‰, i.e. a natural increase rate of 2.38% with a total fertility index of 4.8. Life expectancy at birth is 58.9 years.
Situation politique, administrative et g: Political, administrative situation and governance of the country
Au plan politique, la Guinée s’est engag: At the political level, Guinea is engaged in a democratic process which guarantees fundamental freedoms and rights, including the right to health. Guinea has eight (8) administrative regions including the city of Conakry which enjoys the status of a specific decentralized community.
Le pays compte 33 préfectures, 38 commun: The country has 33 prefectures, 38 urban communes including 5 in Conakry, 324 rural communes or sub-prefectures. These communities are subdivided into 4142 neighborhoods/districts and 15741 villages/sectors. The organizational structure of the health system is modeled on the administrative division of the country; it includes 8 health regions and 38 health districts.
Le pays dispose d'importantes ressources: The country has significant natural resources. Despite its enormous natural potential, Guinea is one of the poorest countries in the world. In 2012, it ranked 178th out of 186 countries on the Sustainable Human Development Index.
La situation socioéconomique de la Guiné: The socio-economic situation of Guinea in 2012 is marked by the persistence of poverty. Indeed, data from the ELEP 2012 (Light Survey for the Assessment of Poverty) indicate that 55.2% of the population lives below the poverty line.
La croissance économique est estimée à 3: Economic growth is estimated at 3.9%, the same level as in 2011, driven mainly by the increase in agricultural production and the good performance of the secondary sector. Tax revenues expressed as a percentage of gross domestic product (GDP) increased from 16.8% to 19.8%, thanks to increased revenues from petroleum products and revenues from international trade.
Entre 2012 et 2016, la mortalité materne: Between 2012 and 2016, maternal mortality increased from 724 to 550 per 100,000 live births, infant mortality decreased from 123‰ to 88‰ and infant mortality from 67‰ to 44‰. Despite the reductions observed, maternal mortality and infant and child mortality still remain very high.
Sur le plan épidémiologique, les princip: On the epidemiological level, the main causes of morbidity and mortality are linked to communicable diseases including diseases with epidemic potential and diseases preventable by vaccination. Lifestyle-related non-communicable diseases are becoming increasingly important.
La prévalence du paludisme reste encore: The prevalence of malaria still remains high with a prevalence of parasitemia in 15% of children. This pathology represents 40.82% of consultations and 45.30% of hospitalizations in public health facilities and 36% of hospital causes of death are due to severe malaria. It is the leading cause of death for children under 5 years old.
Le VIH/sida demeure un problème de santé: HIV/AIDS remains a public health problem with a stable prevalence of 1.7% in 2012. This prevalence is high among groups most exposed to risk, particularly sex workers (16.7%). The prevalence of HIV among pregnant women increased between 2008 (2.5%, ENSS) and 2015 (3.56%, ENSS) and is twice as high as that of the general population.
La prévalence de la Tuberculose, de 178: The prevalence of Tuberculosis, 178 TPM+ per 100,000 inhabitants, still remains high with its double burden of coinfection with HIV/AIDS. With the aim of providing a global and effective response to the health problems of the population, the Government plans to solicit the private sector within the framework of public-private partnerships (PPP) in order to fill the gap in investment capital, technology and of know-how required to improve the efficiency and quality of public service delivery.
Dans le cadre de ces contrats de PPP, le: As part of these PPP contracts, the private sector would be able to participate in the financing or pre-financing of infrastructure. PPPs also allow for better risk sharing between the private and public sectors.

Suite à l’avènement de la deuxième répub: Following the advent of the second republic in April 1984, the churches of Guinea experienced an awakening through the development of humanitarian actions for poor communities. In 1993, the Guinean Government recognized their important role in the sustainable development of communities.
Les domaines d’intervention des Eglises: The areas of intervention of the Churches were initially basic education; then, this field of action was expanded in the areas of health, income-generating activities, food security, Water-Hygiene-Sanitation, community development, peacebuilding. These are, among other things, the axes on which the experience of churches for human promotion has been gradually built for years.
Dans le domaine médical, les églises ont: In the medical field, the churches began separately and gradually by building and opening dispensaries, health centers, clinics, then hospitals. The intervention of churches in the fight against Ebola virus disease has further illustrated them as credible partners in the eyes of the Government through the Ministry of Health and international institutions (UNICEF, USAID, WFP).
D’une part, les activités n’étaient ni c: On the one hand, the activities were neither coordinated nor integrated into the national health system. This compounded an underlying problem as isolated health facilities owned by different Christian churches operated solo with no obvious basis to inform government policy and decision-making. The need for health structures to come together has become an urgent necessity in the face of the difficulties (supply of infection prevention and control inputs, training of staff in infection prevention and control, etc.) that many health structures faced during Ebola.
En effet, sous les directives du Préside: Indeed, under the directives of the President of the Republic at the time, the Guinean government in collaboration with its partners, organized General States of Health (EGS) followed by an institutional, organizational and functional audit in search of the causes dysfunction and poor performance of the health system. The discussions carried out allowed Guinea to adopt a National Health Development Plan (PNDS) 2015-2024 which is essentially based on primary health care and the strengthening of the health system aimed at promoting universal access to services. health.
Deux des faiblesses et non des moindres,: Two of the weaknesses, not the least, noted by the PNDS in the context of governance and leadership, was the absence of coordination of the private sector (numerically important in urban areas) and the lack of regulation and control of delivery structures. private sector care. This same document underlines that the major challenge of the health system for the years to come is the expansion of health coverage to the entire population by strengthening service provision. To meet this challenge, the health system must address the overall improvement of sector governance while strengthening all other pillars of the health system.
D’autre part et eu égard à ces faiblesse: On the other hand and in view of these weaknesses and the commitment of the Christian Church of Guinea to contribute through its health facilities to the improvement of the state of health of the populations and by extension to the integral human development of the communities , associated with the desire of the Ministry of Health to integrate the private health sector into the overall healthcare offering and supported by technical and financial partners such as CRS and DIFAEM, resulted in a constitutive general assembly in June 2016 (12 health structures present) creation of the Christian Confessional Health Network of Guinea (RECOSAC-G), which is the national platform of Christian confessional health structures, and open to all health structures or medical works under the conditions defined in the statutes and internal regulations of the organization, in accordance with the provisions of law L/2005/013 of July 4, 2005, establishing the regime of associations in the Republic of Guinea. And committed in its memorandum of understanding with the Ministry of Health and Public Hygiene (MSHP), to participate in the implementation of the National Health Policy (PNS), the National Development Plan Health (PNDS) and the Health System Recovery and Resilience Plan (PRRSS).
Cependant, l’appui technique et financie: However, the coordinated technical and financial support of CRS (Catholic Relief Services), DIFAEM (German Institute for Medical Mission) and Pain Pour le Monde, as well as the will of public authorities, have provided a boost in the implementation in place and the operationalization of RECOSAC-G from 2017. For the Church, it was a question of making its contribution to strengthening the confessional sub-sector.
